metadata.Title: CVE-2023-22053 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Client programs). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.42 and prior and 8.0.33 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server and unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.9 (Confidentiality and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-22053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-client - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-server - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.1 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1').
